info.title: Tokenization API (V3)
info.description:
You can use the **Tokenization API** to replace sensitive credit and debit card data without the need to expose the cardholder's original account information.

Click [here](../docs/getting-started.md) to get started with this API.

get.description: Use this endpoint to enables the issuer to get tokenization informations for a card

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Dock card ID (e.g. 123)

post.summary: Generate push provisioning payload by cardID for HCE wallets [Visa only]
post.description: Use this endpoint to generate push provisioning payload by cardID for HCE wallets (Android)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Dock card ID (e.g. 123)

post.summary: Generate activation data for SE wallets [Visa only]
post.description: Use this endpoint to generate activation data payload for secure element wallets (Apple)

get.summary: Generate provisioning authentication data by ID for SE wallets [Visa only]
get.description: Use this endpoint to generate provisioning authentication data by ID payload for secure element wallets (Apple)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Dock card ID (e.g. 123)

get.description: Use this endpoint to generate push provisioning payload by `card-id` (Android)

parameters.name: card-id
parameters.description: Dock identification card.

get.description: Use this endpoint to generate a Token Authentication Value (TAV) signature by `card-id` (Android)

parameters.name: card-id
parameters.description: Dock identification card.

put.description: Use this endpoint to enables the issuer to activate a token

parameters.name: operationType
parameters.description:
Operation type. **(conditional VISA)**
Used to specify the device in the operation. (whatsapp)

parameters.name: pan-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the PAN (e.g. V-3021014476122497969633)

parameters.name: token-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the token (e.g. XBITQE302101551801573060)

put.description: Use this endpoint to enables the issuer to activate a token by CorrelationID attribute.

parameters.name: card-id
parameters.description: Card unique ID (e.g. 123)

parameters.name: correlation_id
parameters.description: Value linking pre-digitization messages generated during provisioning (e.g. ATESHE35468214801573060)

put.description: Use this endpoint to suspend an active token

parameters.name: pan-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the PAN (e.g. C-3021014476122497969633)

parameters.name: token-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the token (e.g. DNITHE302101551801573060)

reasonCode.description:
Reason for the activation
Valid values:
"L" - Cardholder confirmed token device lost
"S" - Cardholder confirmed token device stolen
"T" - Issuer or cardholder confirmed fraudulent token transactions
"Z" - Other
**Note: required only Mastercard operations**

put.description: Use this endpoint to unsuspend or resume a suspended token and return it to the active state

parameters.name: pan-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the PAN (e.g. C-3021014476122497969633)

parameters.name: token-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the token (e.g. DNITHE302101551801573060)

delete.description: Use this endpoint to delete a token so that it may not initiate any new transactions

parameters.name: operationType
parameters.description:
Operation type. **(conditional VISA)**
Used to specify the device in the operation. (whatsapp)

parameters.name: pan-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the PAN (e.g. C-3021014476122497969633)

parameters.name: token-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the token (e.g. DNITHE302101551801573060)

204.description: OK - It has no response body for delete.

get.description: Use this endpoint to enables the issuer to retrieve token details for a particular token

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Audit User Id (e.g. AI145530)

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Audit User Name (e.g. John Smith)

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Audit Organization (e.g. Solid Bank Inc)

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Audit Phone (e.g. 5555551234)

parameters.name: pan-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the PAN (e.g. C-3021014476122497969633)

parameters.name: token-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the token (e.g. DNITHE302101551801573060)

get.description: Use this endpoint to enables the issuer to retrieve a list of all tokens for a pan-reference-id

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Audit User Id (e.g. AI145530)

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Audit User Name (e.g. John Smith)

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Audit Organization (e.g. Solid Bank Inc)

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Audit Phone (e.g. 5555551234)

parameters.name: pan-reference-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for the PAN (e.g. C-3021014476122497969633)

line1.description: Street 1 on billing address for the payment instrument

line2.description: Street 2 on billing address for the payment instrument

city.description: The city associated with the enrolled payment instrument

postalCode.description: The postal code associated with the enrolled payment instrument

clientWalletProvider.description: Client wallet provider is the token requestorâ€™s ID(TRID)

clientWalletAccountID.description: Client-provided consumer ID that identifies the Wallet account holder entity

clientDeviceID.description: Stable device identification set by Wallet Provider

clientAppID.description: Unique identifier for the client application, used to provide some of the encrypted values

isIDnV.description: String field to specify if the Issuer wants ID&V to be performed

nonce.description: Required for issuer mobile banking app initiated provisioning requests to Apple

payload.example: eyJhbGciOiJBMjU2R0NNS1 ciLCJpdiI6IkkzeNFIn0.37IzQCaJiH1z NlmxM5lV5c_dSQgtZS_huYfJQrUBnqw. QhCJjN2cgM5AfcnX. XzZF9dVQ5hBqLwaeyvOOiB oqbERAn56QqyQr30mKxZIL8JiQ.GS4i3u3 vCAjkLuHIoBpZPQ

deviceIndex.description:
The index number from Visa where the deviceID is stored
type: integer between 1 and 99, inclusive
**Note: required only Visa for Device Binding operations**

deviceID.description:
For Secure Element (SE) wallet providers,
this value is the SE ID in hex binary characters
transformed to a 48-character string
For Host Card Emulation(HCE) wallet providers,
this field is the device ID as determined by the
digital wallet provider(DWP). All alphanumeric and
special characters are allowed for HCE DWPs
**Note: required only Visa for device binding operations**

ReasonCode.description:
The reason for the action
Valid values:
"A" - Cardholder successfully authenticated with an activation method (activation code by text message, email, issuer mobile application etc.) prior to activation
"C" - Cardholder successfully authenticated with a customer service agent prior to activation
**Note: required only Mastercard operations**

userId.description: User ID of the customer service representative who triggered the API request

userName.description: User name of the customer service representative who triggered the API request

organization.description: Name of the issuer to which the customer service representative who triggered the API request belongs

phone.description: Phone number of the customer service representative who triggered the API request

visaErrorContent.description: **(conditional source VISA)** VISA error response, for more details review VISA documentation.

details.description: **(conditional source MASTER)** Master error response, for more details review Master documentation.

visaErrorContent.description: **(conditional source VISA)** VISA error response, for more details review VISA documentation.

comment.example: Cardholder reported token device found or not stolen

reasonCode.description:
Reason for the activation
Valid values:
"F" - Cardholder reported token device found or not stolen
"T" - Issuer or cardholder confirmed fraudulent token transactions
"Z" - Other
Note: required only Mastercard operations

visaErrorContent.description: **(conditional source VISA)** VISA error response, for more details review VISA documentation.

details.description: **(conditional source MASTER)** Master error response, for more details review Master documentation.

reasonCode.description:
Reason for the delete
Valid values:
"L" - Cardholder confirmed token device lost
"S" - Cardholder confirmed token device stolen
"F" - Issuer or cardholder confirmed fraudulent token transactions (Deprecated)
"T" - Issuer or cardholder confirmed fraudulent token transactions
"C" - Account closed
"D" - Issuer consumer deleted
"Z" - Other
**Note: required only Mastercard operations**

deviceIndex.description:
The index number from Visa where the deviceID is stored
type: integer between 1 and 99, inclusive
maxLength: 2
**Note: required only Visa for device binding operations**

deviceID.description:
For Secure Element (SE) wallet providers,
this value is the SE ID in hex binary characters
transformed to a 48-character string
For Host Card Emulation(HCE) wallet providers,
this field is the Device ID as determined by the
digital wallet provider(DWP). All alphanumeric and
special characters are allowed for HCE DWPs
**Note: required only Visa for Device Binding operations**

visaErrorContent.description: **(conditional source VISA)** VISA error response, for more details review VISA documentation.

details.description: **(conditional source MASTER)** Master error response, for more details review Master documentation.

tokenRequestorID.description: Unique ID to the initiator of the token request

clientWalletAccountID.description: Consumer ID identifying the wallet account-holder entity

token.description: The token associated with the PAN

tokenExpirationDate.description: The date upon which the token is set to expire.

deviceId.description:
For Secure Element (SE) wallet providers,
this value is the SE ID in hex binary characters
transformed to a 48-character string
For Host Card Emulation(HCE) wallet providers,
this field is the Device ID as determined by the
digital wallet provider(DWP). All alphanumeric and
special characters are allowed for HCE DWPs

deviceName.description: A readable name for the device. Ideally, the customer enters this name.It can be used to identify the device in customer support calls

osVersion.description: Version of the operating system running on the device

deviceIndex.description: The index number from Visa where the deviceID is stored

deviceType.title: DeviceType
deviceType.description:
Device type
Valid Type [Visa]:
- UNKNOWN
- MOBILE_PHONE
- TABLET
- WATCH
- MOBILEPHONE_OR_TABLET
- PC
- HOUSEHOLD_DEVICE
- WEARABLE_DEVICE
- AUTOMOBILE_DEVICE
Valid Type [Mastercard]:
- PHONE
- TABLET
- KEY_FOB
- TABLET_OR_EREADER
- WATCH
- WATCH_OR_WRISTBAND
- CARD
- STICKER
- PC
- DEVICE_PERIPHERAL
- TAG
- JEWELRY
- FASHION_ACCESSORY
- GARMENT
- DOMESTIC_APPLIANCE
- VEHICLE
- MEDIA_OR_GAMING_DEVICE
- UNDEFINED

tokenRequestorID.description: Unique ID to the initiator of the token request

clientWalletAccountID.description: Consumer ID identifying the wallet account-holder entity

enum: Awaiting cardholder acceptance of Terms and Conditions
Token being delivered to Wallet Provider or device
